title: upgrade issues going from 4.5.7 to 5.0.0 (rc3)
body:
i run owncloud on an xubuntu 12.10 system. i have the owncloud ubuntu repository (deb http://download.opensuse.org/repositories/isv:owncloud:community/xubuntu_12.10/ /
) in my apt sources.list file so this morning (11th march) my owncloud installation was automatically updated from 4.5.7 to 5.0.0rc3. the result was a completely broken installation (now working again, no major problems). this raises a number of issues though:-

1 - should the repositories get release candidates in them? it's certainly not the normal ubuntu way of doing things, in any given ubuntu release you normally only get bug fixes and security updates, not major release updates. betas and release candidates should surely be separate and not offered for automatic updates.

2 - the new version installed into .../owncloud-enterprise while the old version was in .../owncloud. this doesn't seem to be documented anywhere.

3 - many of the files and directories (but not all) were owned by root after installation had completed, they should be owned by www-data (or whatever the web server process owner is).

when i copied the data and config across from the 4.5.7 installation to the new 5.0.0rc3 one everything updated very smoothly and seems to be working well. if the above issues can be fixed this will be a very neat and easy upgrade.
